org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement

Class CacheReplicationMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.CacheReplicationMonitor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Runnable

    @InterfaceAudience.LimitedPrivate(value="HDFS")
public class CacheReplicationMonitor
extends Thread
implements Closeable
    Scans the namesystem, scheduling blocks to be cached as appropriate. The CacheReplicationMonitor does a full scan when the NameNode first starts up, and at configurable intervals afterwards.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        Thread.State, Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

        private final long intervalMs
        The interval at which we scan the namesystem for caching changes.

      • lock

        private final ReentrantLock lock
        The CacheReplicationMonitor (CRM) lock. Used to synchronize starting and waiting for rescan operations.

      • doRescan

        private final Condition doRescan
        Notifies the scan thread that an immediate rescan is needed.

      • scanFinished

        private final Condition scanFinished
        Notifies waiting threads that a rescan has finished.

      • completedScanCount

        private long completedScanCount
        The number of rescans completed. Used to wait for scans to finish. Protected by the CacheReplicationMonitor lock.

      • curScanCount

        private long curScanCount
        The scan we're currently performing, or -1 if no scan is in progress. Protected by the CacheReplicationMonitor lock.

      • neededScanCount

        private long neededScanCount
        The number of rescans we need to complete. Protected by the CRM lock.

      • shutdown

        private boolean shutdown
        True if this monitor should terminate. Protected by the CRM lock.

      • mark

        private boolean mark
        Mark status of the current scan.

      • scannedDirectives

        private int scannedDirectives
        Cache directives found in the previous scan.

      • scannedBlocks

        private long scannedBlocks
        Blocks found in the previous scan.

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class Thread

      • waitForRescanIfNeeded

        public void waitForRescanIfNeeded()
        Waits for a rescan to complete. This doesn't guarantee consistency with pending operations, only relative recency, since it will not force a new rescan if a rescan is already underway.

        Note that this call will release the FSN lock, so operations before and after are not atomic.

      • setNeedsRescan

        public void setNeedsRescan()
        Indicates to the CacheReplicationMonitor that there have been CacheManager changes that require a rescan.

      • close

           throws IOException
        Shut down the monitor thread.

             throws InterruptedException

      • resetStatistics

        private void resetStatistics()

      • rescanCacheDirectives

        private void rescanCacheDirectives()
        Scan all CacheDirectives. Use the information to figure out what cache replication factor each block should have.

      • rescanFile

        private void rescanFile(CacheDirective directive,
              INodeFile file)
        Apply a CacheDirective to a file.
        Parameters:
        directive - The CacheDirective to apply.
        file - The file.

      • findReasonForNotCaching

        private String findReasonForNotCaching(CachedBlock cblock,
                             BlockInfoContiguous blockInfo)

      • rescanCachedBlockMap

        private void rescanCachedBlockMap()
        Scan through the cached block map. Any blocks which are under-replicated should be assigned new Datanodes. Blocks that are over-replicated should be removed from Datanodes.

      • addNewPendingUncached

        private void addNewPendingUncached(int neededUncached,
                         CachedBlock cachedBlock,
                         List<DatanodeDescriptor> cached,
                         List<DatanodeDescriptor> pendingUncached)
        Add new entries to the PendingUncached list.
        Parameters:
        neededUncached - The number of replicas that need to be uncached.
        cachedBlock - The block which needs to be uncached.
        cached - A list of DataNodes currently caching the block.
        pendingUncached - A list of DataNodes that will soon uncache the block.

      • addNewPendingCached

        private void addNewPendingCached(int neededCached,
                       CachedBlock cachedBlock,
                       List<DatanodeDescriptor> cached,
                       List<DatanodeDescriptor> pendingCached)
        Add new entries to the PendingCached list.
        Parameters:
        neededCached - The number of replicas that need to be cached.
        cachedBlock - The block which needs to be cached.
        cached - A list of DataNodes currently caching the block.
        pendingCached - A list of DataNodes that will soon cache the block.

      • chooseDatanodesForCaching

        private static List<DatanodeDescriptor> chooseDatanodesForCaching(List<DatanodeDescriptor> possibilities,
                                                 int neededCached,
                                                 long staleInterval)
        Chooses datanode locations for caching from a list of valid possibilities. Non-stale nodes are chosen before stale nodes.
        Parameters:
        possibilities - List of candidate datanodes
        neededCached - Number of replicas needed
        staleInterval - Age of a stale datanode
        Returns:
        A list of chosen datanodes

      • chooseRandomDatanodeByRemainingCapacity

        private static DatanodeDescriptor chooseRandomDatanodeByRemainingCapacity(List<DatanodeDescriptor> targets)
        Choose a single datanode from the provided list of possible targets, weighted by the percentage of free space remaining on the node.
        Returns:
        The chosen datanode
